STBLKeyStringList.Text: {0.SimFirstName} feels instantly attracted to {1.SimFirstName}. Sims become attracted or unattracted to others based on their Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs. Sims will recognize some Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs instantly, like those dealing with colors or fashion. Others' Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs will require Sims to learn more about each other before causing attraction to change.

At a glance {0.SimFirstName} has a neutral attraction to {1.SimFirstName}. Sims become attracted or unattracted to others based on their Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs. Sims will recognize some Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs instantly, like those dealing with colors or fashion. Others' Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs will require Sims to learn more about each other before causing attraction to change.

{0.SimFirstName} is instantly unattracted to {1.SimFirstName}. Sims become attracted or unattracted to others based on their Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs. Sims will recognize some Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs instantly, like those dealing with colors or fashion. Others Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs will require Sims to learn more about each other before causing attraction to change.
Well, there are a few things I care about when it comes to a partner's personality. These are the things I care about:\n\n{2.String}
Looks aren't everything, but truthfully I do look out for some physical aspects in a partner:\n\n{2.String}
In fact, I do care about my partners' Romance Style. Here's what moves me:\n\n{2.String}
The Woo-Who!? players learned the following about {1.SimFirstName} while playing the game: \n{2.String}
{0.SimFirstName} saw {1.SimFirstName} break {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Romantic Boundaries and is thinking of getting a Divorce.
{0.SimFirstName} saw {1.SimFirstName} break {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Romantic Boundaries. {0.SimPronounSubjective} will Divorce {1.SimFirstName} if it happens one more time.

{0.SimFirstName} saw {1.SimFirstName} break {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Romantic Boundaries and has decided to get a Divorce. {0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} are no longer married. Romantic Satisfaction will no longer be tracked.

{0.SimFirstName} saw {1.SimFirstName} break {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Romantic Boundaries and has decided to Break Up. {0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} are no longer partners. Romantic Satisfaction will no longer be tracked.
{0.SimFirstName} saw {1.SimFirstName} break {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Romantic Boundaries. {0.SimPronounSubjective} will Break Up with {1.SimFirstName} if it happens one more time.
{0.SimFirstName} saw {1.SimFirstName} break {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Romantic Boundaries and is thinking of Breaking Up.
{1.SimFirstName} is getting fed up with {0.SimFirstName} being mean to {1.SimPronounObjective} and is thinking of getting a Divorce.
{1.SimFirstName} is getting fed up with {0.SimFirstName} being mean to {1.SimPronounObjective}. {1.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} will Divorce {0.SimFirstName} if it happens one more time.

{1.SimFirstName} is fed up with {0.SimFirstName} being mean to {1.SimPronounObjective} and has decided to get a Divorce. {0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} are no longer married. Romantic Satisfaction will no longer be tracked.

{1.SimFirstName} is fed up with {0.SimFirstName} being mean to {1.SimPronounObjective} and has decided to Break Up. {0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} are no longer partners. Romantic Satisfaction will no longer be tracked.
{1.SimFirstName} is getting fed up with {0.SimFirstName} being mean to {1.SimPronounObjective}. {1.SimPronounSubjective} will Break Up with {0.SimFirstName} if it happens one more time.
{1.SimFirstName} is getting fed up with {0.SimFirstName} being mean to {1.SimPronounObjective} and is thinking of Breaking Up.
(From Bringing a Date to a Romantic Spot)
(From Using a Romantic Blanket in a Romantic Spot)
(From Viewing a Sunset at a Romantic Spot)
(From Walking a Romantic Path While Flirty)
{0.SimFirstName} prefers slow-burn connections, feeling very uneasy when there isn't a strong foundation of friendship. For {0.SimPronounObjective}, love is an intensely serious matter.
Wonderful! The hidden cameras are already outside your window. Don't bother looking for them, they are really small. Get dating!
We respect that. It's okay, we have another reality show idea, Love Isle: Crumplebottom Edition. It's going to be great!

Congrats! You have won the 7 Wild Dates Challenge, and our hidden cameras recorded everything. We will air your segment in a week, and it's sure to be our next new hit!

Grand Prize:
• §25,000!
• A Heart Bed!
• Free Couple's Counseling for 4 Weeks!
You didn't have 7 perfect dates. So yeah, sorry no money. However, this drama is gold and has skyrocketed our ratings! So thanks!
I'll get my heart bed revving. Hurry!
You're what? You would choose that dumb game over me? What a loser.
Well okay then... Guess I'll get my own food.
You can? Oh wow. Hey, I could really go for some cheese pizza right now... (that's still vegetarian isn't it?)
You are? Oh sweetie you are so good to me! Could you get tacos?
Oh that's swell! Let me get my jacket and I will come to your house right away. See you soon!
Huh. I guess I can see that. Let's pretend this never happened, okay?
Oh okay. Well, thanks for humoring me. I had to give it a shot. My name is {1.SimFirstName} if you ever change your mind.

Hey, that's great! I would send a limo but I'm kind of a cheapskate. I'll be waiting at the Beso Rápido Motel in Vista Hermosa, Ciudad Enamorada. I can only meet today, very busy with many CEO things. Hope to see you.
Fair enough. I have to get back to running Social Bunny anyways which involves posting at least 12 incoherent posts a day.
(From Being Stood Up by Wealthy Weirdo)
Hey, thanks for meeting me. Oh you wanted some gifts, right? Check your pockets!
IT'S HAPPENING!! We are officially back together now! I'm coming to your place right away!!
Take all the time you need. I'm here for you.
Oh...oh I'm sorry... I think I uh...never mind.
Wait wait... YOU are breaking up with ME!? I don't...I don't understand... Didn't you enjoy playing Woo-Who with me?
Come soon. I've got to work something out with you.
Good. I like your enthusiasm. I'll see you here soon.
Do you see this fur? Do you see my bear-looking face? This is no mere costume. This is 100% quality, real-life BEAR right here.
What do you mean a bear costume? I'M A BEAR.
Your eyes must be playing tricks on you. I'm a real bear. Don't question my bearness.
Are you talking to some person behind me dressed in a bear costume? Because I'm not dressed as a bear... I'm A BEAR!

I'm glad you figured out my ring. I guess I started dressing as a bear after my fiancé gave my ring back. Or maybe the ring was cursed? Who knows...

All I know is when I was a kid my mom used to dress as a bear with me. It was a bit of a phase I went through. I guess I missed her...

...I can stop being a bear now.
You're asking me?! Look in the mirror! I'm just a bear... you're the one wearing a bear outfit! You've got issues.

I once was a Sim like you. I used to think love was the meaning of life. It is not. It is a vicious cesspool of rejection that will turn your heart into a bag of shattered glass. I tried to use the ring's magic or whatever to fix everything, BUT IT JUST BACKFIRED! Now, I'm cursed to live my remaining years as a bear. Just be careful.

I was engaged. Yup. Proposed to my dearest and thought we were made for each other. But then that ring cursed me! It turned me into the bear you see before you now. I strongly advise that you DO NOT FALL IN LOVE.

Um... I don't know to be honest. I was fishing one moment and, well, now I'm here. I guess I started missing that Sammy guy who used to stand out here. He had the right idea. Call me a cynic, but... why go to work when you can just be a bear?

Try to find the Ask for Attraction Level social in the Learn More category under Relationship when you click on a Sim. You can also try Explain Attraction Level to give them details on how you feel about them.

You can't play games with these things. Just go up to someone and say "Do you like me?" They will probably say no. Most of them have said no to me. Figures. I'm a bear. It just wouldn't work.\n\nTry to find the Ask for Attraction Level social in the Learn More category under Relationship when you click on a Sim. You can also try Explain Attraction Level to give them the deets on how you feel about them.
The Costume Trunk might be just what you need to spice things up. You can buy one in the Recreation Category under Activities and Skills in Build Mode.

When I was a kid, my Brother Sunny and I had A LOT of Costume Trunks and would use them to dress up in all kinds of crazy costumes. He always used to dress up as a clown. Weird guy.\n\nAnyways, the Costume Trunk might be just what you need to spice things up. You can buy one in the Recreation Category under Activities and Skills in Build Mode.
If you want, you can do all kinds of Activities through Ask to Create a Date within the Romance category when you click on a Sim.

You actually want to go on a date? And you have to be with someone? Yeesh. Not me. I'm a bear. I just do bear stuff.\n\nBut if you want, you can do all kinds of Activities through Ask to Create a Date within the Romance category when you click on a Sim. There you can find all kinds of activities to torture yourself with!
If you want to give online dating a try, look for Cupid's Corner app on your phone and create a profile.

Have you heard of the Cupid's Corner App? It's all the rage these days. My heart is too broken to even try that.\n\nBut if you want to give it a try, just look for Cupid's Corner on your phone and create a profile. I hope all the best for you.
If you are thinking of it, try Cupid's Counseling under the Cupid's Corner app on your phone. It's the one with the little heart and arrow.

There is nothing wrong with getting therapy. I still see my therapist every week! She thinks I'm just making up all this bear stuff. Maybe I am. Who knows... Life is hard. Bear life is much easier.\n\nIf you are thinking of it, try Cupid's Counseling under the Cupid's Corner app on your phone. It's the one with the little heart and arrow. Apparently Social Bunny Inc. owns that now. I know... big corporations ruin everything... (sigh)
If you have a romantic partner, it's important to Ask about Romantic Boundaries which can be found in the Learn More category under Relationship.

Ah yes... Boundaries. Those things I always somehow cross and ruin everything. Bears have no boundaries. We just do what we do.\n\nBut, if you have a romantic partner, it's important to Ask about Romantic Boundaries, which can be found in the Learn More category under Relationship. Communication is key to a good relationship... Jeesh, I feel like a therapist.

Romantic Satisfaction is a measure of how satisfied you and your partner feel in the relationship. If you have a romantic relationship with someone and you would like to know how they feel about you, you can Ask about Romantic Satisfaction in the Learn More category under Relationship. You can also View Relationship in there as well.

The problem with love is you have to do things. Doing things is hard. You might as well be a bear. Us bears just eat from the trash and sleep.\n\nAnywho, Romantic Satisfaction is a measure of how satisfied you and your partner feel in the relationship. If you have a romantic relationship with someone and you would like to know how they feel about you, you can Ask about Romantic Satisfaction in the Learn More category under Relationship. You can also View Relationship in there as well. So... yeah... good luck with all that non-sense.

Romance can take on different Dynamics. You can be Wholesome, Steamy, Strained, or Unpredictable. If you try different things like having an exceptional WooHoo or catching someone cheating, you might find things changing!

Romance can be tricky, okay? One moment, they make you feel on top of the world, and the next, they want nothing to do with you. It's enough to make me thankful I'm a bear now and don't have to put up with it.\n\nBut romance can take on different Dynamics. You can be Wholesome, Steamy, Strained, or Unpredictable. If you try different things like having an exceptional WooHoo or catching someone cheating, you might find things changing!
If you'd like a Romantic Blanket you can find one in Build Mode under the Recreation Category in Activities and Skills.

I saw some cuddly, new Romantic Blankets at the store the other day. If I had Simoleons, I'd buy one. I'm a bear though so... yeah no blankets for me.\n\nIf you'd like a Romantic Blanket you can find one in Build Mode under the Recreation Category in Activities and Skills. However there was one blanket I saw that made me very sad. You'll see for yourself. You people are monsters.
If you are good at games, though, try picking up Who's Up Party Games. You can find one under Recreation in the Activities and Skills part of Build Mode.

The only game I know how to play is guessing how much trash people throw away in trash cans. Anything they don't want.... BAM! In the trash. Just like me.\n\nIf you are good at games, though, try picking up Who's Up Party Games. You can find one under Recreation in the Activities and Skills part of Build Mode. It's a great way to learn about other Sims (if you're into that sorta thing).

Lots of reasons, friend. The main reason is I've lost my ring.\n\nWell, I sort of threw it in the nearby pond. I've tried fishing it out but I'm terrible at fishing (that was always her thing). If you are able to fish it out, let me know. That ring has some kind of special romantic magic about it. I can tell you more later.
The lack of connection is causing dread of solitude. Encourage your Sim to nurture their relationships or learn to enjoy their own company. Remember, being alone doesn't have to mean being lonely.
Intimacy comes at a price and {0.SimFirstName} isn't sure they want to pay it.
Haunted by the fear of getting too close, your Sim struggles with the vulnerability that comes with intimacy.
(From Getting Nauseous on a Vibrating Bed)
(From Being Awoken by a Vibrating Bed)

{0.SimFirstName} has experienced a lot of turmoil in {0.SimPronounPossessiveIndependent} romantic life; if {0.SimFirstName} doesn't take safety measures, this could result in {0.SimPronounPossessiveIndependent} death by a broken heart. Until this sad mood passes, stay away from rejection, jealousy, horrible dates, depressed eating, and bad breakups.\n\nIf {0.SimFirstName} is already in a relationship, {0.SimPronounSubjective} might want to consider relationship counseling. Otherwise, try working on {0.SimFirstName}'s romance skills, or crying it out.
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling the negative effects of love and is truly suffering. Something is approaching....
I see. I validate your emotions. I validate your negativity. It is okay, {0.SimFirstName}. Let the emotions spill forth from you no matter how much it annoys others around you. This is a safe space.

I'm sorry that you're feeling that way. Our emotions are like a turbulent swarm of bees. But we can't run away from the bees. No. We must run towards the bees. Yes, they'll sting. But we must accept the sting. Our relationships can only blossom if we let ourselves get stung by bees.
I'm glad you are voicing your feelings. You are being your own true self. You are so much better than my last client. Can you believe it: he thought he was an actual bear.

It's so good to hear that you are feeling well! Let the feelings wash over you like syrup on pancakes. The spongy bread of your relationship can soak up the gooey positivity and provide you with years of delicious happiness.

Are you really feeling that way, {0.SimFirstName}? Emotions are like a sink. If we don't pay attention to them, we might find ourselves washing our emotion dishes in a bathroom rather than a kitchen. Come back to the kitchen, {0.SimFirstName}. We're all waiting for you here...

There's something else you are not telling us, {0.SimFirstName}. Don't suppress your negative emotions. Let them flow from you. Cry. Cry, my Beloved client... You are worthy... You are enough... You are delicate...
I understand, {0.SimFirstName}. It is okay to be okay. I'm okay too, you know? Ok.

Well that's good! It is good to realize that no matter how bad things get, it will always pass. There is no cheat code to fixing our emotions instantly or giving us instant Simoleons. If we could just type in a cheat code and fix our lives that would be great, but we have to be realistic.

Hmm... interesting... it seems as if your inner Sim is trying to tell you something, isn't it? Maybe it's this: Stop the cycle. You wake up. Go to work. Use the toilet. Eat dinner. Go back to sleep. Repeat. Repeat. Repeat. It's all meaningless, {2.SimFirstName}, don't you see? You must look inside and ask yourself: What do you really want?

That sounds difficult, {2.SimFirstName}. We don't have control over the world around us. In fact, sometimes it might seem like we don't have control over ourselves. Like some outside force is controlling us and we have no ability to make our own decisions. Suddenly we find ourselves at a sink holding a glass of water... but... why? Let go of the glass of water, {2.SimFirstName}. You don't need it.
Fantastic, {2.SimFirstName}! Take notice of your feelings in your body now. Your eyes. Your ears. Your shirt. This is what feeling good feels like. You are exactly where you are supposed to be.

That's nice that you are in a good mood! Feeling good is great! Now what we must do, {2.SimFirstName}, is look ahead. Goals. Goals, {2.SimFirstName}. When you set your goals, make sure they are Direct, Understandable, Mature, and Big! If you follow my four step goal structure to success (and keep giving me money), there's no way you can fail!

You can't? Based on what your romantic partner has told me over the phone your life is a complete mess, {2.SimFirstName}. Are you telling me that those were lies? Or are you lying to yourself? Stop lying, {2.SimFirstName}. Start BEing.

Now {2.SimFirstName}... of course you can complain. We don't spend a lot of time paying attention to our emotions. They tend to stack up and suddenly it's a giant mess and nothing makes sense. We push the sadness down and pretend to be happy, but what happens when that happiness goes away, {2.SimFirstName}? That's right: The sadness is still there.
If your mood is good that's great. It is important to constantly check in with ourselves. Like a mailbox. Be a mailbox, {2.SimFirstName}.

That's so great to hear! Soak it up, {2.SimFirstName}. Life is a chaotic dance. Our motivations ebb and flow like the wind. We must take care of ourselves first and foremost before we can devote ourselves to others. Start getting to know the person within, {2.SimFirstName}!

Get to know what Turn-Ons or Turns-Offs you have towards each other and work towards improving yourselves. I can't wave a magic wand and instantly make each of you attractive...but not everything is set in stone! Become more skilled in activities that attract your partner or even just change your wardrobe to make the difference.

You may find there are particular Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs that don't seem to resonate with you anymore. When this happens, no worries! Just use the Change Sim action on the Dresser and you can be as loosey-goosey as you want with your particular desires.

I can imagine you may find all the possibilities of Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs quite confusing. It may be difficult to tease out just what an attractive quality means. If you are confused, try to study more about each Turn-On or Turn-Off within the Change Sim menu on the Dresser.

The first step is Knowing if your partner is attracted to you. You can start by Asking About Attraction Level in the Learn More... Category under Relationship or by Explaining Attraction Level to disseminate your feelings towards them. You might find your attraction towards each other is mismatched, but that's okay! That's why we are here today!
You both are yelling at each other and not making a lot of sense. Remember we need to treat each other with respect.
CALM DOWN!!! YOU TWO ARE NUTS!!! This is not how therapy is supposed to work!! I don't get paid enough for this!!
What I am seeing is a severe lack of control on the part of both of you. We can't move forward until you both learn to control yourselves.
Let's put away the claws! There's no need for anger in this conversation. If you two can't learn to talk to each other I'm going to have to put you both in the corner to think about what you've done.
When I hear you both speak to each other, what I'm hearing is mutual respect. What I make up about that is you are resolving your issues in a meaningful way...
Good that we are hurting but also healing. These are the difficult conversations that we have to have and I applaud you both for your courage.
This is a healthy argument you two are having. I am so pleased to see it. We are making such momentous progress. Happiness is just a therapy appointment away.
Doesn't it feel good to get those feelings off your chest? It is important to be honest to each other and communicate!
{0.SimFirstName} and {2.SimFirstName} learned about each other's Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs in therapy!\n\nCheck View Relationship under the Relationship Category to learn more!

If you work on your Romantic Satisfaction hard enough, you might find your Romantic Relationship trending in a positive direction without having to even try. However, if you find yourselves unsatisfied you might find your Romantic Relationship falling apart faster than you thought possible. I hope I am outlining just how important Romantic Satisfaction can be in your relationship.

Romantic Satisfaction can be different between the two of you. For instance, you might feel Very Unsatisfied in the relationship while your partner feels as happy as a clam. Try to Ask about Romantic Satisfaction in the Learn More... Category under Relationship to know more about how you two feel about where things are.

Have you discussed your Romantic Boundaries with one another? We all have different expectations from one another. If we don't make those known, we might find our boundaries being violated, which greatly affects Romantic Satisfaction.

What I would recommend is learning your partner's Romance Style. You may find your partner expects more Physical Intimacy or perhaps Affection. Once you've learned these desires, don't forget to DO what they expect! Relationships are all about give and take!
{0.SimFirstName} and {2.SimFirstName}'s Romantic Satisfaction has improved in therapy. Healing starts with love.\n\nCheck View Relationship under the Relationship Category to learn more!

If you are Yelling At each other one moment and Woohooing the next, you might find yourself with an Unpredictable Dynamic. Couples like this are hot and cold...up, then down...it just doesn't sound very sweet to me!
If you want a Steamy Dynamic, let me ask: How are things in the bedroom? Remember: A dozen Woohoos a day keeps the nosy therapist away! (snarky laugh)

If you desire a Wholesome Dynamic, try spending some quality time together. For instance, try Cooking Together every once in a while or Plan a Social Event with your partner. I know you two can do it!

If you are not happy with the current dynamic of your relationship, try having a conversation with your partner about it! Try to Ask to Work on Romance Dynamic. If you both agree to it, you might find it easier to change the dynamic than you would have otherwise.
{0.SimFirstName} and {2.SimFirstName}'s Romance Dynamic has changed during their latest therapy session!\n\nCheck View Relationship under the Relationship Category to learn more!

Practice makes perfect! You have the ability to improve your skills in Romance or Charisma! You may even just talk to yourself in the mirror if all else fails. Becoming more socially skilled can do wonders for increasing your romantic comings and goings.

Pay attention to the discussion at hand. If you are listening closely to your partner you may be able know when the conversation has become Unpleasant or Awkward. Sometimes you just have to step away from each other and try again at another time.

It's best to make sure you are being romantic at the right moments. If either of you are in a bad mood, you might not find your romantic gestures going over too well. If either of you are feeling Flirty, though, then be proactive! Flirt like there is no tomorrow!

There are many different factors to having good romantic socialization with your partner! Mood, Social Skills, Attraction, and Romantic Satisfaction all can play a part. One might falsely think that a positive response from a romantic partner is somewhat random, but that's not true! So don't just do the same things over and over hoping for success, be mindful of everything that is happening in your experience!
{0.SimFirstName} and {2.SimFirstName}'s Romantic Relationship has improved in their latest session of therapy!\n\nCheck the Relationship Panel in the bottom right corner for more information.
Okay. I understand your frustration. Let's talk about Attraction...
You are having trouble with satisfaction in the relationship. Let's talk about it...
Do you not like how the Romance Dynamic is playing out? We can work with that...
You would like to improve your overall romantic relationship? Let's get into it...

Oh? You think I'm a quack? Well that is just your opinion. I'll have you know I spent the required number of years at the University of Britechester and have my degree in Psychological Trickery. I could have worked in many dubious industries... but I wanted to work for the good of humankind!
Good. I am booked up pretty heavy for the week but just keep checking back with my receptionist and they will let you know when I can pencil you in.
Good. Good. Increase your attraction for each other. Find out what attracts your partner and work towards that. I wish you both well.
Wonderful! Might I suggest purchasing a Costume Trunk or Who's Up Party Games? Things like this are fun but also allow you to get to know each other.
Oh {0.SimFirstName}, there is no such thing as perfect. However ambition is something I admire. Go with peace, friend.
Ah yes. Please do. Improve your romantic lives. A little flirt here and there shows you care for one another.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} have a strong Romantic Relationship and will now each have independent Romantic Satisfaction levels.\n\nHigh Romantic Satisfaction will make maintaining Romantic Relationship easier, low Romantic Satisfaction will make maintaining Romantic Relationship more difficult.

{1.SimFirstName} and {0.SimFirstName} have a strong Romantic Relationship and will now each have independent Romantic Satisfaction levels.\n\nHigh Romantic Satisfaction will make maintaining Romantic Relationship easier, low Romantic Satisfaction will make maintaining Romantic Relationship more difficult.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} have entered into an official relationship and will now each have independent Romantic Satisfaction levels.\n\nHigh Romantic Satisfaction will make maintaining Romantic Relationship easier, low Romantic Satisfaction will make maintaining Romantic Relationship more difficult.

{1.SimFirstName} and {0.SimFirstName} have entered into an official relationship and will now each have independent Romantic Satisfaction levels.\n\nHigh Romantic Satisfaction will make maintaining Romantic Relationship easier, low Romantic Satisfaction will make maintaining Romantic Relationship more difficult.
I’m feeling Very Unsatisfied in our relationship! If you are Mean to me while I feel this way, our Romantic Relationship will suffer!
I’m feeling Very Unsatisfied in our relationship! If you are Mean to me while I feel this way, I may have to Break up with you!
I’m feeling Very Unsatisfied in our relationship! If you are Mean to me while I feel this way, I may have to Divorce you!

{0.SimFirstName}'s Romantic Satisfaction with {1.SimFirstName} has changed based on {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Romance Style Turn-Ons or Turn-Offs.\n\nRomance Style Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs play a critical role in affecting a Sim's individual Romantic Satisfaction with their partner when socializing.
{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} have officially broken up.\n\nRomantic Satisfaction will no longer be tracked.
{1.SimFirstName} and {0.SimFirstName} have officially broken up.\n\nRomantic Satisfaction will no longer be tracked.
The Romantic Relationship between {0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} has fizzled away.\n\nRomantic Satisfaction will no longer be tracked.
The Romantic Relationship between {1.SimFirstName} and {0.SimFirstName} has fizzled away.\n\nRomantic Satisfaction will no longer be tracked.
Entering adulthood comes with big changes for any Sim. {0.SimFirstName}'s previous Romance Dynamics have fallen away as {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} perspective of the world broadens.
Everything has gotten on my nerves today. I didn't know how to handle it alone, so now I'm here.
I've had a terrible day and I'm fired up! Maybe I just need to sit down. Can I come in?
Hi. I'm feeling really down today. Is it okay if I come in? I think I just need to mope for a while.
I guess I woke up on the sad side of the bed this morning. I'm feeling pretty blue. Can I come in?
Hey, I wanted to stop by and say hi. I've had a really stressful day. Sorry to just show up like this.
Mind if I come in? I feel off today, almost like someone else is controlling my actions. I'm sure it's my imagination, but it's making me feel on edge!
I found myself lost today, not in thoughts but in the thoughts of you. I had to come by to see you.
I was feeling in the mood so I was hoping if I stopped by you might be available for some...canoodling?
I just happened to be in the neighborhood, but when I passed by your place I felt your love like a strong magnet pulling me to you—so I decided to drop in and say hello...hello?

{1.SimFirstName} wasn't open to working on the Romance Dynamic with {0.SimFirstName}. {0.SimPronounSubjective} will have to try again after some time has passed and both Sims are ready to talk—both in a good mood and in a positive conversation.

{0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} agreed they want a change in their romantic relationship. As long as they change their behavior, it will be easier to change their Romance Dynamic along with it.\n\nThis openness to change lasts a few days. If {0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} can't find a new Romance Dynamic, nothing will change and they will have to wait a while before trying this again.

{0.SimFirstName} has discovered a new personality trait, Romantically Reserved! It replaced {0.SimFirstName}'s Romantic trait. Learn more about this new trait in the Traits section of the Simology Panel.
{0.SimFirstName} has discovered a new personality trait, Romantically Reserved! Learn more about this new trait in the Traits section of the Simology Panel.

{0.SimFirstName} is a Romantically Reserved Sim. These Sims navigate the path of love with thoughtful consideration, cherishing the depth of emotional bonds rather than the rush of fleeting attractions. For them, a romantic journey is painted with heartfelt conversations and significant actions that strengthen their bonds. However, taking such a cautious approach to love may occasionally result in missed chances at romance, a small trade-off for the meaningful connections they form.

Romance Styles Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs determine how a Sim feels about various expressions of romance in their relationships with other Sims.\n\nSims with a Turn-On for a given Romance Style will gain extra Romantic Satisfaction from performing these types of interactions. Likewise, Sims with a Turn-Off for a given style will lose Romantic Satisfaction from these types of interactions.

Choose your Sim's Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs. These control how romantically Attracted or Unattracted they are toward other Sims: higher levels of Attraction make Romantic interactions easier. Romance Style Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs determine how this feels about different types of romance (such as Flirting or Gift Giving.)

Slacker\n\nSims with this Turn-On are attracted to Lazy Sims or Sims without a career.

Affection Affection interactions tend to express passion and vulnerability, such as Whisper Sweet Nothings, Express Fondness, and Talk About Relationship Fears.
  • Sims with a Turn-On for Affection gain Romantic Satisfaction from Affection interactions.
  • Sims with a Turn-Off for Affection lose Romantic Satisfaction from Affection interactions.

Flirting Flirty interactions range from chaste to steamy, including Make a Flirtatious Joke, Ask Risque Question, or even Seduce with Costume.
  • Sims with this Turn-On gain Romantic Satisfaction from Flirt interactions.
  • With the Turn-Off, Sims lose Romantic Satisfaction from these interactions.

Gift Giving Gift Giving includes classics like flowers and chocolates, but there are many more possibilities. It's the thought that counts!
  • Sims with this Turn-On gain Romantic Satisfaction from giving and receiving gifts.
  • With the Turn-Off, Sims lose Romantic Satisfaction from gifting.

Physical Intimacy Physical Intimacy covers a spectrum of romance but always involves physical contact between Sims such as Snuggle, Give Massage, or Make Out.
  • Sims with this Turn-On gain Romantic Satisfaction from Physical Intimacy.
  • With the Turn-Off, Sims lose Romantic Satisfaction from these interactions.

A result of grafting embryos together, this 'firefly' type has a golden body and copper-brown tail. Other axolotls probably think it is lazy at washing and never makes it to the tail.
This split "chimera" look of two colors happens when two eggs merge naturally. Almost like a chocolate and vanilla ice cream coming together for a tasty swirl cone. Don't lick this though...
This "firefly" axolotl is the result of joining embryos, creating a different colored body and tail. Do you think it forgets and scares itself when it sees its own tail?
This axolotl has one of the darkest complexions found and has little to no iridescent coloration.
This bold and blue axolotl is the result of fluorescent proteins introduced to their genome in a lab. Other axolotls use it as a reading light.
This glowing axolotl is the result of humans adding fluorescent proteins to the genome. Between this and the golden skin it has taken 'glow up' to new heights!
No, it isn't half-done applying make-up. This natural wonder results from two developing eggs fusing.

How did these four very different Sims end up living together? It's all for the plot, okay? Carmen, notably a retired CEO of extreme success, was looking for some entertainment in her golden years after the passing of her wife. Carmen met Elia years ago when they were hired as her company chef, and the duo have been inseparable ever since. Manuel joined the gaggle of friends more recently after meeting Elia and Carmen on a night out. He became instantly obsessed with Carmen, who found his larger-than-life personality amusing and his attraction flattering but silly. Quickly after, Manuel's close friend and style advisor, Yoltic, joined in on the roomie fun. Who knows what crazy romantic endeavors the world has in store for this household!

Did you wish for happiness at the Fountain of Dreams? Well, here is your answer! A perfect plot of land to build a home on! This lot is close enough to the park that you can enjoy all of its offerings without traveling too far away from home.

When looking for the perfect place to live the life of a sweetheart-seeking single, look no further! Calle del Ensueño provides a stunning view of Plaza Mariposa and a serene and romantic atmosphere, making you and that potential sweetheart feel right at home. Make sure to stop at the Fountain of Dreams to wish for happiness for you and your partner!

To find one's other half is a magical moment, and Media Naranja, nestled in the stunning Plaza Mariposa, offers a magical setting for that moment to blossom. With a panoramic view of the surrounding park, the inside bar provides a sweet, serene getaway for couples to bond over a nice drink or two.

This rental is equal parts luxury and mystery. They say the house belonged to a young couple madly in love—Samuel and Claire—but suddenly became vacant. The stories say Claire broke the heart of poor Samuel, and the house was abandoned soon after. Despite its tragic backstory, couples travel far and wide to stay in this gorgeous and conveniently located rental to prove that their love is strong enough to withstand its heartbreaking past. Still...some folks say you can still hear the cries of a broken-hearted Samuel ringing through the central square.

This mysterious nightclub is for the seekers of sultry seduction. The tantalizing Mirador del Amor's allure lies in its dimly lit secluded areas, perfect for hushed whispers and dreamy sighs. For those without a partner, well, there's plenty of space on the dance floor, and plenty of time to look for love.

Overlooking Nuevo Corazón, this penthouse is the epitome of elegance and luxury. Sit amongst the clouds and let the breathtaking view set the scene for the countless romantic memories you will assuredly make here. This sky-high love nest is perfect for all your future romantic adventures.

When Aziz and Valentina first met, they were drawn to each other by their mutual passion for love as two high schoolers working at a flower store creating anniversary bouquets for couples in their rural hometown. While this peaceful lifestyle felt perfect for Aziz, Valentina always wanted to move to the city and turn her romance obsession into a more ambitious career. After overcoming many ups and downs in their youth to save up and move to the city, they've finally made it big—well, at least Valentina feels like she has. Valentina, the renowned Matchmaker of Ciudad Enamorada, puts all her effort into her newfound life passion: helping others find spectacular love like her and Aziz's. Aziz, however, feels a little left behind in this whole plan. This was never his dream, and his wife is constantly preoccupied with other couples' problems rather than their own. Will Valentina spend so much energy on other couples to the point of her own relationship falling apart? Or will she learn to find a balance between her passions for love, work, and Aziz?

Take your love to new heights and see the sunrise across the beautiful Nuevo Corazón in this luxurious, ready-to-move-in penthouse. Enjoy the view and relax with your love, new or old, in your arms instead of struggling to get the couch up all those stairs. Nobody has time for that when love is in the air!
This gym has everything: a swimming pool, exercise equipment, and most importantly, singles ready to mingle. The heart is a muscle, you know, and love is the best workout routine there is.

This home is a dream come true for a thriving family that wants to skip the stress of moving on up and enjoy new memories together right away. Give you and your partner the perfect setting for a lifetime of happiness. With the heart of the neighborhood just a short walk away, purchasing this home is an easy choice.

This lounge, located in the center of Vista Hermosa, holds a special place in the hearts of many locals. This hot spot welcomes couples and singles alike, providing an atmosphere of dim lights, smooth music, and excellent company. Romantics should take a short walk across the street to the famed Wall of Love, where locals have written their love declarations for generations, hoping for many years to come with their special someone. A few steps more leads to Beso Rápido, a local motel previously run by the well-known Carmen Ortega before her retirement.

This lot, though currently vacant, is brimming with the potential for romantic experiences. The proximity to the picturesque Plaza Mariposa is sure to ignite even the most dormant of hearts with passion. Imagine strolling hand in hand with your special someone, seeking the perfect spot to lay a blanket and create a night of cherished memories.

Young couples looking to be close to the beating heart of this cozy suburban neighborhood will love this quaint, ready-to-move-in home! Singing, drinking, and a fun game of Who's Up are just minutes away at the Laguna del Abrazo. A perfect date spot for a casual night on the town.
Home is just a few bricks away on this lot, perfectly situated on the outskirts of Vista Hermosa. With stunning views and friendly neighbors, this charming little spot is ready and waiting for you.

After Monica's ex-husband discovered a hidden talent for competitive lawn gnome sculpting and decided to leave the family to pursue a career in the quirky world of gnome artistry, things have been a bit different for the López household. Monica was struggling to believe she could ever find love again and dedicated her livelihood to the wellbeing of her children instead. However, now that the children are getting older and she is faced with the terrifying prospect of an empty nest, Monica decides it is time to rediscover her romantic side—little did she know this would happen by her falling for the one and only Manuel Aguilar, the notorious dreamboat in town...who just happened to have attended high school with her son. With Carlos feeling particularly threatened by his former classmate as he enters the unpredictable adult dating world alongside his mother and Luz entering teenhood with an already nervous approach to romance, is there a future of happiness and love for the family?

Pambazo is a traditional Mexican dish made by dipping stale bread in a spicy guajillo pepper sauce, then stuffing it with chorizo, potatoes, lettuce, cheese, and cream. It's a delicious, hearty sandwich often enjoyed as street food, offering a burst of flavors and textures with every bite.

Grilled Fish Talla-Style is a Mexican dish featuring grilled fish marinated in adobo sauce. It involves butterflying a whole fish, marinating it in a blend of guajillo and ancho chilies, garlic, and spices, then grilling it to perfection.\n\nLactose Free

Vegan Pambazo features sautéed potatoes and chorizo substitute sandwiched between stale bread rolls, dipped in spicy guajillo sauce, and griddled until crispy. It's a tasty, satisfying vegan twist on a traditional Mexican street food, topped with fresh lettuce and vegan cream.\n\nVegetarian-Safe

Sims with a Steamy Romance Dynamic can't keep their hands off of each other. These Sims prefer Romantic interactions when socializing, especially those that involve Physical Intimacy. They are more likely to gain Enamored sentiments with one another.

Sims with a Strained Romance Dynamic have a bit of tenseness in their relationship that is hard to work through. These Sims fail at Friendly and Romantic socials more than other Sims and gravitate towards Mean socials. They are more likely to gain Hurt or Furious sentiments towards each other.

Sims with an Unpredictable Romance Dynamic are hot and cold with an intense chemistry—they go from a heated argument to a heated kiss in no time. These Sims prefer Physically Intimate Romantic interactions or Arguments when socializing, and are notorious fans of a good Kiss and Makeup. They are more likely to gain Bitter Sentiments towards each other.

Sims with a Wholesome Romance Dynamic love one another in the most tender and affectionate kind of way. While these Sims do enjoy romancing each other, they are also fond of interacting in Friendly and Funny ways. Wholesome partners understand each other on an intimate level both as friends and lovers. These Sims gain Enamored and Close Sentiments more easily.

Affection Aficionado Sims have slower Romantic Satisfaction loss in relationships with other Sims.

Sims with the Romantic Sage trait have a learned optimistic and thoughtful outlook on romantic relationships. Their Romantic Satisfaction decreases slightly slower than other Sims, and when they receive a negative moodlet related to a romantic experience, they are able to Remember Positive Romantic Experiences to help ground themselves.

The third category of Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs are Romance Styles.\n\nThese are the different ways Sims can give and receive love. These Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs don’t affect Attraction levels. Instead, they control how various types of romance contribute to each Sim’s individual Romantic Satisfaction—not all Sims feel the same way about all forms of romance after all! (See the Romantic Satisfaction lesson)

How does one Sim know what another Sim finds attractive? Well, by asking them! Select another Sim, choose the “Relationship” category, then choose “Ask about…Attraction” interactions to find out the various Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs of other Sims.

Likewise, the way to know another Sim’s overall Attraction level is by asking. Select another Sim, choose the “Relationship” category then the “Learn More” category, and finally choose “Ask for Attraction Level.”

Sims may be able to make themselves more attractive by avoiding a partner’s Turn-Offs and meeting their Turn-Ons—for example, by changing hair color or cultivating new Skills—but some Sim couples may simply have to put in extra effort or call it quits if Attraction grows to be unmanageable!

Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs are set in Create a Sim and determine how attracted Sims are to each other. Sims can be attracted to physical attributes (like hair or outfit color) or their personality and characteristics. Sims attracted to your Sim will be easier to build romantic relationships with. Attraction can change as the Sims get to know each other based off of their Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs.

The Relationship panel on the skewer and the Sim Info panel show the Attraction between two Sims. No Attraction icon will appear on other Sims when your Sim has Neutral Attraction to them or otherwise does not experience Attraction at all.\n\nYour Sim’s individual Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs are listed in the Simology panel. Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs can be changed at any time through Create a Sim.

Sims will be attracted to each other at different levels of intensity:

• Very Attracted
• Attracted
• Neutral
• Unattracted
• Very Unattracted

Attraction level is determined by how many Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs are being met and will affect Sims in various ways: Sims will prefer to socialize with Sims they are attracted to. Sims are also more likely to accept romantic interaction from Sims they find attractive. The opposite is also true: Sims are less likely to socialize with Sims they find unattractive and less likely to accept romance from those Sims.

Depending on their Physical Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs, a Sim may experience instant Attraction to a potential romantic interest. However, the story doesn’t end there!

As your Sim gains knowledge about another Sim, Attraction can go up or down depending on Personality Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs. Learning new personal information such as Traits, Skills, or even financial status can significantly change the Attraction level your Sim feels toward another.

Sims feel Attraction based on their most recent knowledge. If your Sim is turned off by Nature activities and meets someone with low Gardening skill, that Turn-Off won’t really do anything. However, if that other Sim later builds up to high Gardening skill and your Sim finds out, the Turn-Off will trigger and potentially lower your Sim’s Attraction level to the unlucky gardener.

At any time, you can toggle between your Sim experiencing Attraction for all Sims that match their romantic attraction, or only for Sims with whom they share a romantic relationship. Select your Sim then choose “Disable Attraction" or change back by choosing “Enable Attraction.”

To set or change a Sim’s Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs, go to Create a Sim and select the Preferences tab underneath Aspirations. Select the tab with the magnet icon to see the different categories of Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs that make up Attraction. Select any category to set specific Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs. Each Sim may have up to 50 Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs, and these can be changed at any time through Create a Sim.

The Attraction level felt toward another Sim is controlled by the Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs set inside the Physical and Personality categories:

Physical Attraction covers everything seen on a Sim’s outside: fashion choices, clothing color, and hair color. These Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs register immediately when Sims socialize with each other.

Personality Attraction relates to a Sim's Traits, hobbies, and other aspects of their lives that aren't outwardly apparent. Sims will need to ask potential partners about themselves in order to fully understand how attractive (or unattractive) one Sim is to the other! These Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs have a stronger influence on Attraction between Sims.

Unlike the Romance score that is shared between two Sims, Attraction is an individual feeling of one Sim toward another. A Sim may be attracted to someone who does not share the feeling, and Sims in a relationship may find themselves with totally different Attraction levels!\n\nCautious Sims may want to exhaust their knowledge of a potential partner before diving into a commitment! (See the Create a Date lesson to learn how to set up Sims on the perfect “Get To Know You” casual date.)

Turn-ons and Turn-Offs are what attract one Sim to another. The attraction can be towards the Physical or Personality attributes of a Sim and Romance Styles. (See the Attraction lesson for more information)\n\nThe following slides reference what each Turn-On or Turn-Off comprises, such as skills, personality traits, or other personality factors.

Physical Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs Looks aren't everything...but they're definitely a conversation starter! Physical Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs between Sims determine the Attraction between two Sims instantly, without having to get to know each other better. Changing outfits or hair color can affect a Sim's Attraction level, so select a Sim, and in the "Relationship" category, choose "Ask about Physical Attraction" to find out what look might catch the eye of the romantic interest. The different categories of Physical Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs include: • Outfit Color • Fashion Type • Hair Color

Romance Styles The different ways Sims can give and receive love. Affection: Interactions such as: • Whisper Sweet Nothings • Express Fondness • Talk About Relationship Fears Flirty: Interactions such as: • Make a Flirtatious Joke • Ask Risque Question • Seduce with Costume Gift Giving: Interactions of giving gifts such as: • Flowers • Chocolates Physical Intimacy: Interactions such as: • Snuggle • Give Massage • Make Out Mess Around/WooHoo: This is a distinct Turn-On/Turn-Off from Physical Intimacy.

Time to choose your type of date! Choose a Get To Know You Date or a Romantic Date to set a romantic scene just as you like it. Choose a Romantic Repair Date if your Sims have low Romantic Relationship - just not too low - sometimes Sims can have such low Romantic Relationship they won't want to go on a date at that moment.
Creating a Date allows you to choose from three types of dates: Get To Know You Date, Romantic Date, or a Romantic Repair Date. Choose activities you want your host Sim to accomplish with their date.

If you want to Create a Date, there are a few ways to get started. You can initiate the date by selecting a Sim in the Relationship Panel, select Ask On, then Ask to Create a Date. You can also select the Sim you wish to ask out on a date where Ask to Create a Date will appear in the Romance category.\n\nBe sure to watch those Traits! If you ask a Sim out, they may not always say yes. An Unflirty Sim might decline a date when asked but higher Romantic Relationship should help.

Time to get the date started! Your host Sim will be able to accomplish Goals on the date based on the Activities chosen for the date. Your Sim can do these Activities any place on the date venue. Once your host Sim completes their goals, you'll see the date progress. You'll see the date meter along with the timer that shows you the progression of the date.

Select Activities you want your Sims to do on the date - this will create goals that will determine if you have a Bronze, Silver, or Gold date. Select a venue that you feel will be best for your date - don't forget that you can switch the venue on your date if you need to! To switch the venue during the date, select your Sims date and choose "Date Actions". From there, you can "Ask to Extend Date" to last longer and "Ask to Change Venue".

Whether you want to foster the love of your Sims or tear their families apart, Ciudad Enamorada is brimming with opportunities to do both. We all have to start somewhere. Why not try Cupid's Corner, a Matchmaking app that can help you find your future flame? First dates can be awkward, but love can blossom from the most unlikely pairings when Attraction is involved! Ask to Create a Date, pick the activities yourself, and choose one of the many romantic hot spots within the city. For example, Media Naranja Park in Plaza Mariposa is perfect for a picnic on a Romantic Blanket or searching for Axolotls by the pond! While on a date, consider a few of these fun (and even risqué) activities for dates to enjoy! The Who's Up Party Game is a great alternative to small talk for breaking the ice and can reveal enough about a Sim to change the Attraction levels. Mood not quite right? The García Amor Costume Trunk can provide a little spice to the sweet and set the tone for a magical night, which may involve a Vibromatic Nuevo heart bed to shake things up. Already in a relationship? How is that going? High Romantic Satisfaction is key to a good relationship. When both Sims are satisfied in a relationship, the relationship is bound to be strong. A Romance Dynamic may develop depending on how a Sim interacts with a Partner! This will affect how a couple interacts with each other, for better or for worse! It's up to you to determine whether you're looking for a heartwarming Wholesome dynamic, or a drama filled Strained dynamic. So, when exploring a new relationship, remember these key things: no matter what love story you want to tell, it will be one for ages.

The Matches page will be a selection of potential matches for your Sim. Here you will have a variety of Sims to Like who will be saved for later. In each of their profiles you will see a photo of the Sim, their age, their location if they've chosen to share it, and two of their traits.\n\nWhen you see the Sim's traits you may notice that your Sim is attracted to or repelled by this trait, but when these Sims meet in person you may find that attraction is more intricate than just a trait or two. You will also see an option to Refresh the Sims available in your Matches page. After you've done this once you will need to wait some time before you'll be able to refresh again.
Welcome to Cupid's Corner! This Matchmaking app is exclusive to Young Adult and older Sims to meet other Sims. It is a great way to meet potential matches.

After navigating to the Saved page you will see the Sims who you've previously liked from the Matches page. Here you'll be able to take a variety of actions: Add to Contacts, Create a Date, or Remove Sim. When planning a date your Sim will immediately go on a date, which is a great way to get to know the other Sim and kickstart their relationship.\n\nSims added to the contacts will show up in your Sim's Relationships panel and will allow you to take the relationship at your own pace whether that's by chatting on the phone or inviting them to hang out at a lot. Removing Sims can open up room for more Sims in your Saved page, whether that's because you've already added them to your contacts or made the decision that they weren't the right Sim for you.

On the My Bio page you will see information about your Sim. Included is their Sexual Orientation and options for selecting which age group of Sims they are looking to meet. You will be able to select two traits from your Sim to highlight to other Sims and take a selfie that shows off your Sim.\n\nSelfies are a great way to display some personality for your Sim, but you might need to work on your Photography Skill if your pictures aren't turning out good.

Within the Cupid's Corner phone menu you'll see there are a few additional options. From here you can go on a Blind Date which is great if you're looking for a little more adventure, and maybe some unusual Sims will show up. There's also an option to visit Cupid's Counseling with your partner if you need to work through any issues in your relationships. Then there is the option to Deactivate Cupid's Corner if you're not interested in this app for your Sims.\n\nHowever you use Cupid's Corner it's here to make it easy for you to meet new Sims.

A Sim's Romantic Satisfaction goes up from having positive romantic experiences. Succeeding at romantic socials is important, but don't forget about Sim's Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs! Knowing the Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs of each Sim in a relationship is important: catering to Turn-Ons and avoiding Turn-Offs will build high satisfaction. On the other hand, Sim couples who can't maintain mutual satisfaction will find it harder to keep up the relationship. Blundering into a Partner Sim's Turn-Offs will certainly drive their satisfaction down. (As will breaking Romantic Boundaries—"cheating" on a Partner.)

Sims may have very different or even opposing Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs. Each Sim will have their own needs in a relationship, reflected in their own satisfaction level. Ignore these needs at your Sims' romantic peril! When Sims meet and introduce each other, you get to learn some of their Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs. You'll find out more as they continue to interact and get to know each other. Want to adjust your Sim's Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs? Head to Create a Sim, then Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs next to Likes and Dislikes.

Sims will start thinking about Romantic Satisfaction with a Partner after they have "made it official" or built a high enough level of romantic relationship. Lovebug and Romantic Sims will start with a slightly higher level of Romantic Satisfaction, while Romantically Reserved and Noncommittal Sims will start with a slightly lower level. They will stop thinking about it with that Partner once the relationship has ended or the Sim pair's romantic relationship level has dropped to a low enough level.

Romantic Satisfaction reflects how fulfilled a Sim feels in a romantic relationship. Unlike the shared romantic relationship level, each Sim in the relationship has their own individual level of satisfaction. Couples with high mutual satisfaction will find it much easier to keep a strong relationship.

Sims have the opportunity to move on to more advanced subjects through two specialized branches. The goal of the first branch, Matchmaker, is to bring compatible Sims together to form the ideal marriage. To determine what is important for each client, a Sim will research topics like forms of intimacy and love expressions. They can also dabble in the affairs of others by Suggesting Cupid's Corner or Asking about Recent Dates. In addition to centering on relationships, the second branch, Relationship Counselor, also links in Romantic Satisfaction, Sex Education, and Relationship Goals. This branch focuses on supporting couples through any trials they may face while providing resources to overcoming and building stronger connections.

To progress and cater to their unique clientele, it is imperative that Romance Consultant Sims gather knowledge and inspiration from sources including Romance Station, TV Channels, and reputable sources on the Web. From there, your Sim can interact and impact other Sims in the realm of love.\n\nA significant factor in how that is absorbed through others is the Romance Skill. Be sure to pay attention to your Sim's skill level and increase it to ensure interactions end favorably.

Each level of the Romance Consultant career prepares the Sim for unique situations such as lovers quarrels, dating expectations and handling broken hearts. Sims in this career have access to unique interactions that have the potential to mold each Sim into the ideal lover or companion while earning rewards along the way.\n\nEarn chic workwear that is sure to turn heads and capture hearts. Sims can take some romantic flair home as well through career reward objects such as Love's Little Book Collection, Kiss of the Night Couch, or the Cornery Feelings End Table.

If your Sim is discontent with their Romance Dynamic, you have some options.

In the Relationship section of the Pie Menu on your Sims' partner, your Sim can Ask to Work on Romance Dynamic. If this is successful, both Sims will be considered Working on Romance Dynamic, which means they will be able to develop a new Romance Dynamic more easily through interacting with each other for a period of time, and have reduced negative effects of any Romance Dynamic they may currently hold.

Another option to help modify your Romance Dynamic is the Romance Dynamics Dissolver Potion in the Rewards Store - or, you could just Break Up!

Romance Dynamics define the relationship between a Sim and their romantic partner, and can be acquired through selection in Create a Sim or through gameplay when two Sims exhibit the behavior typical of that Romance Dynamic.

You'll notice that Sims will autonomously interact with their partner in a way that reflects their Romance Dynamic - for better or for worse! Romance Dynamics also cause Sims to respond a bit differently in socialization with their partner, so you'll notice some effects on your Sim's Mood.

Romance Skill gives Sims more ways to woo, wow, and be a better partner. Sims can develop their Romance Skill through Romantic socialization, reading Romance Skill books, and Researching Romance Tips on the computer.\n\nRewards include learning how to do a Seductive Dance, Dip Kiss, Scan the Room for potential partners, and give off an Aura of Flirtiness!

Not everyone wants to live the nightlife. Some would like to settle down, and Vista Hermosa is perfect for easy-going couples to set up a home with their family. Couples can write their name on the Wall of Love, hoping for a lifetime of happiness. Visit Laguna del Abrazo for a drink and a good time, or maybe stop at the Beso Rápido Motel across the street for something more intimate...a good night’s rest.

Welcome to Ciudad Enamorada, where romance flourishes, and the heart grows fonder. This colorful city embodies love, with plenty of places to bond with your special someone. How about adding something extra to your date? Try out local cuisine at the food stalls throughout the city, or purchase something nice for your sweetheart at Isabela’s Flower Shops. From date spots for couples to bustling hot spots full of eligible singles, Ciudad Enamorada provides anything one might need to lose oneself in passion and timeless memories.

Plaza Mariposa is the beautiful picturesque central square nestled within the bustling city of Ciudad Enamorada and provides an enchanting backdrop for a sunset stroll with the love of your life. Media Naranja is a park that offers perfect spots for a moment of tranquility over delicious drinks while you gaze at the luscious greenery around you. The local cuisine at the food stalls or the charming gifts from Isabela’s Flower Shop will only add to the romantic atmosphere. For those from out of town, the vacation rental Villa Cálida is ready for you and your beloved to visit and experience the city for yourself. Don’t forget to make a wish at the Fountain of Dreams!

Rebuilt and modernized, Nuevo Corazón is the pinnacle of Ciudad Enamorada nightlife. Immerse yourself in the sultry ambiance and discover potential paramours at Mirador del Amor, a nightclub for those looking for mystery and allure. After a night of energetic dancing, recharge and build your stamina at SUDOR, a gym where you can train your endurance and maybe even find a new workout partner.
Determine who your Sim is attracted to by customizing their Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs in their Attraction Preferences!

Select Turn Ons and Offs including Hair Color, Romance Styles, Characteristics, Fashion, and more! These preferences will affect your Sim’s Attraction and Relationship Satisfaction with their partner.

Plaza Mariposa, the central square of Ciudad Enamorada, is the spot for scenic views and fun date night activities. Visit Media Naranja, the perfect park to stop at for a quick refreshment, or book a captivating getaway at the Villa Cálida rental. Excite your date with a romantic gift from Isabela's Flower Shop, or make a wish at the Fountain of Dreams.

The pulsing nightlife of Ciudad Enamorada is the most exciting within Nuevo Corazón. This revitalized city area is where trendy partygoers head for a night on the town, scoping the room for the next potential love interest. Brave into the alluring and mysterious Mirador del Amor, the nightclub known as the hotspot for torrid affairs and passionate practitioners of the romantic arts. Not everyone enjoys the nightlife, though, so for you daytime daters, break a sweat and flex some muscles at the gym SUDOR.

The serene embrace of Vista Hermosa sets the stage for a wide array of romantic experiences. Locals often visit Laguna del Abrazo, a bustling hot spot just a short walk from the renowned Wall of Love, where sweethearts can declare their love for each other. For those seeking a different type of connection, visit Beso Rápido, a conveniently located motel open 24/7.
